translation.en: [Belinda] We were coming out of the house.
This is gonna be my car in the driveway.
And then the Ford Expedition drove past…
[Belinda] And you could just see every seat was filled.
Crystal, Juan, and my son Justin
translation.ko: 크리스털, 후안 그리고 제 아들 저스틴이

translation.en: were getting in the car.
[Justin] Get in the car, she popped the seat forward. I was like,
translation.ko: 동생이 차에 탈 때 좌석을 앞으로 밀기에 제가 그랬죠

translation.en: "Scoot over. We're not hitting no main streets."
translation.ko: '좀 옆으로 가 큰 도로로 안 나가잖아'

translation.en: "We're going three, four blocks up the road to 7-Eleven. Scoot over, sis."
translation.ko: "저스틴 시어벌드 벨린다의 아들" '편의점까지 서너 블록밖에 안 되니 끼어 앉아', 그런데…

translation.en: And, uh…
translation.ko: '편의점까지 서너 블록밖에 안 되니 끼어 앉아', 그런데…

translation.en: We didn't even make it past the end of the street.
I get right up here.
I look over, and he's standing there, right by the stop sign.
translation.ko: 넘겨다 보니 그 남자가 정지 신호 바로 옆에 서 있더군요

translation.en: And the white Ford Expedition turns all the way around,
and he comes sliding back in, and he stops right here.
translation.ko: 가던 쪽으로 돌아오더니 바로 여기서 멈췄어요

translation.en: [Belinda] I race this way,
and I stop to see what's going on with the kids.
[Justin] As we came around I look over, there's a guy with a hooded sweater
translation.ko: 지나가면서 넘겨다 보니 후드 스웨터를 입고

translation.en: with a gun, probably a foot and a half away from me.
translation.ko: 총을 든 남자가 제게서 50cm쯤 떨어진 곳에 있었어요

translation.en: [Belinda] I see the gun.
And he was moving his mouth, like, trying to work his way up to it.
translation.ko: 입을 움직이는 게 보였고 차를 겨냥하는 거 같았어요

translation.en: Bang, bang, bang.
[Belinda] And all the explosions, and the glass, the tires screeching.
translation.ko: 폭발음과 유리 깨지는 소리에 타이어 마찰 소리가 났죠

translation.en: [dispatcher] We're getting several calls, more than four shots heard…
translation.ko: 전화를 몇 통 받았는데 총이 네 발 이상 발사됐고…

translation.en: [man] The shots were fired, and, uh…
-[dispatcher] They shot at you? -[Belinda] They were shooting at me.
translation.ko: - 어머니 차를 쐈다고요? - 네, 저한테 쐈어요

translation.en: I just ducked down in the seat thinking, "Oh, my God."
I don't even know if they hit the car.
I looked over at my sister and she was just, like, motionless.
translation.ko: 크리스털 쪽을 봤는데 이러더라고요 움직임이 없었어요

translation.en: -[dispatcher] What's the problem? -[woman] The car came just barreling in.
-It's a Honda Accord. And they came up-- -[dispatcher] What color Honda?
[Justin] We made it to right in front of a grocery store,
right in front of the doors.
I got out of the car, and I picked her up, and I'm sitting there holding her.
translation.ko: 차에서 내려 동생을 안고 앉아 있었어요

translation.en: [woman] Someone's been shot that's on the floor. It seems like she's not responding.
translation.ko: 총에 맞아 쓰러졌는데 아무 반응이 없는 거 같아요

translation.en: Address is…
And I felt her head, and…
[dispatcher] RP's going to be responding. It looks like we have a victim.
translation.ko: 신고자가 곧 응답할 겁니다 희생자가 있는 것 같아요

translation.en: [officer] Patrol, what's your twenty…?
[Justin] God says, "Ask and you shall receive."
I did.
So where was he? He also says everything is according to his plan.
translation.ko: 그런데 어디 계셨죠? 모든 게 하나님 계획이라고 했는데

translation.en: What kind of fucked-up plan is that?
Where's the loving God in my life?
translation.ko: 내 인생에 사랑의 하나님은 어디 계시냐고요?

translation.en: [voice breaks] And I don't get it.
I just want to know why, you know? Why?
translation.ko: 전 이유를 알고 싶어요 도대체 왜죠?

translation.en: [Jaimie] It was midnight, and my grandma was in the living room crying.
And they said, "Crystal's been shot."
I said, "Crystal's been shot?" They said, "Crystal's been shot in the head."
translation.ko: "제이미 크리스털의 사촌, 23세" '크리스털이 총에 맞아요?'라고 물으니 머리에 맞았다더군요

translation.en: The first memory of Crystal I have,
she liked to play baby dolls with me, and she would always ask me questions.
translation.ko: 저와 인형 놀이를 같이했고 항상 이렇게 물어봤던 거에요

translation.en: "Oh, Jaimie, did Annabelle get her bottle?" She would make, like…
She would make my playtime fun.
And, uh, she really did. She opened my imagination.
[voice breaks] She made sure that I knew that nothing's impossible.
Everything is possible.
[Jaimie] And I went on MySpace.
[Jaimie] Tonight, a horrible tragedy has happened.
I blogged about that. That's how I got my emotions out.
translation.ko: 그 일을 포스팅했고 그러면서 제 감정을 표출했어요

translation.en: I didn't cry at home.
[Jaimie] I just typed.
I just let my fingers go and… type away.
translation.ko: 제 손가락이 가는 대로 자판을 두드렸어요

translation.en: The very last sentence:
"Crystal, please be okay. I love you more than life itself."
translation.ko: '크리스털, 제발 나아 언니를 내 목숨보다 사랑해'

translation.en: She didn't wake up.
[Belinda] I remember her being here and,
just expect her to…
walk through the door again.
It's not going to happen.
[Belinda] When we think of our family and the good times, it's like,
translation.ko: 우리 가족이 행복했던 시절을 생각하면 뭐랄까

translation.en: there's a line drawn.
Before Crystal and after Crystal.
She… She was just my pride and joy. I wanted a daughter so bad.
translation.ko: 제 자랑거리이자 기쁨이었고 간절히 원해서 낳은 딸이었어요

translation.en: Had three sons.
And so the fourth one it was like, "Yay, got my little girl."
translation.ko: 넷째는 드디어 딸을 갖게 돼 너무 좋았거든요

translation.en: She was my sunshine. She was my life. My life. Yeah.
translation.ko: 그 애는 제 태양이었고 제 삶 자체였어요, 아무렴요

translation.en: She would do anything.
She loved heights and roller coasters, and she was so lucky at the casino.
translation.ko: 높은 곳을 좋아했고 롤러코스터를 즐겼고 카지노에 가도 운이 따랐어요

translation.en: She went to a machine and put five dollars in it,
and won $38,000.
And started an air-conditioning heating business with her husband.
They just took off with it.
And then her husband fell back to drug use and the violence.
translation.ko: 그런데 남편이 마약에 빠졌고 폭력을 썼어요

translation.en: And so Crystal left him and was back with us.
translation.ko: 크리스털은 남편과 헤어지고 우리 집에 와 있었어요

translation.en: Yeah.
Just so many memories. God, just so many memories.
translation.ko: 추억이 너무 많아요 세상에, 추억이 너무 많아요

translation.en: A lot of good memories too, but that one night,
translation.ko: 좋은 추억도 많았는데 그 하룻밤이 모든 걸 앗아갔네요

translation.en: that's all it takes.
[man] Yeah, same tattoo on the neck.
[Rick] We have a picture of a grim reaper that sits on the desk
translation.ko: 다음 사건을 맡을 사람의 책상 위에는

translation.en: of the person who's next up.
It's like death is always kind of waiting,
and when you're at the top of the list, that's your case.
translation.ko: 명단 맨 위 사람에게 사건이 배정됐죠

translation.en: You have no idea what you're going to catch. And it was my turn.
translation.ko: 무슨 사건이 걸릴지 몰랐는데 그 사건이 제 차례였어요

translation.en: [Rick] We've got a shooting over on the west end of the city,
translation.ko: 도시 서쪽 끝에서 총격전이 있었단 제보를 받고

translation.en: so I get dressed, kiss my wife, drive in, and then your brain starts running.
translation.ko: 옷을 입고 아내에게 키스하고 오는데 온갖 생각이 들더군요

translation.en: My first murder case was a gang shooting.
translation.ko: "바리오스 사건 수사 오리무중" 첫 살인 사건이 갱 총격전이었고 그런 사건은 특히나 힘들죠

translation.en: Those are always extremely difficult.
translation.ko: 첫 살인 사건이 갱 총격전이었고 그런 사건은 특히나 힘들죠

translation.en: That one case, unfortunately, remains open right now.
translation.ko: 그 사건은 안타깝게도 아직 미제로 남아있어요

translation.en: There's still a guy out there that's gotten away with the ultimate crime.
translation.ko: 극악무도한 범죄의 범인이 아직 거리를 활보하고 있고

translation.en: I still think about it.
Uh, my second one was the Crystal Theobald case.
translation.ko: 그리고 두 번째가 크리스털 시어벌드 사건이었죠

translation.en: I mean, I can't let two go. There's just no way that two are gonna go,
translation.ko: 그 두 사건은 못 잊어요 절대 잊을 수가 없죠

translation.en: but it started off pretty rocky.
They had multiple casings at the scene,
right at the intersection of Greenpoint and Geranium.
[Rick] They had what might've been a shoe involved in it, so they identified that for us.
translation.ko: 사건과 관련이 있어 보이는 신발이 있어 그것도 확인했고요

translation.en: But I get a chance to see where evidence items are,
translation.ko: 하지만 전 증거물이 어디 있었는지도 봤고

translation.en: photographs and measuring of evidence, video.
I'm… My brain was flooded, especially being new in the unit.
translation.ko: 수사에 처음 합류한 저는 뇌가 터질 것 같았죠

translation.en: It's almost like overload.
[cop] Riverside Police Department.
They had witness statements. Gone door-to-door. We do what we call a canvass.
translation.ko: 증인 신문을 했고 집집마다 다니며 탐문 수사도 했어요

translation.en: -[cop] You didn't hear any gunshots? -[woman] We were inside tonight.
translation.ko: 총소리 못 들으셨어요? 오늘 밤엔 집에만 있었어요

translation.en: [cop] You didn't hear anything or see anything?
translation.ko: - 본 거나 들은 거 없어요? - 집에 없었어요

translation.en: -[man 1] I wasn't here. -[man 2] No, I was asleep.
translation.ko: - 본 거나 들은 거 없어요? - 집에 없었어요 - 아뇨, 자고 있었어요 - 주무셨다고요?

translation.en: [cop] You were asleep?
Anyone that might have either ear or eyeshot of the incident.
translation.ko: 사건 현장을 봤거나 들은 사람이 있을 수도 있었죠

translation.en: [cop] You didn't hear any gunshots?
[man 3] No. My wife said she heard, you know, several pops, yeah.
translation.ko: 전 못 들었는데 아내가 몇 발 들었다고 했어요

translation.en: [cop] She didn't see anything?
There were a couple of detectives who were at the hospital.
They're trying to talk to the family,
but they're not being cooperative with the detectives.
I didn't like them. I didn't like them. Didn't…
Didn't like them one bit and… you know, so…
translation.ko: 조금도 정이 안 갔어요 그래서요 뭐, 어쩌겠어요

translation.en: She wasn't exactly trusting of me. She didn't know who I was, and--
translation.ko: 저를 안 믿더라고요 제가 누군지도 몰랐고…

translation.en: I didn't call the police to help me if I had an issue.
translation.ko: 전 문제가 있어도 경찰에 신고 같은 거 안 했어요

translation.en: I didn't. It wasn't the police I called.
They were coming at my family like we were the ones that did it.
Threatening and telling my boys, "I'll lock you up."
"You know, if we catch wind of…" You know, that made me upset.
translation.ko: '너희들 감옥에 갈 거야' 그래서 전 화가 났어요

translation.en: They put me in handcuffs and throw me in the back of a cop car
translation.ko: 수갑을 채우고 절 경찰차 뒤로 밀어 넣더니

translation.en: and interrogate me for hours.
And I didn't get it, didn't understand.
[Ben] Took the detectives and I told them, I said,
"My family had nothing to do with this."
translation.ko: 우리 가족은 이 일과 상관없다고요 "벤 마리오티 크리스털의 양부"

translation.en: You want them to know I'm doing everything I can to help.
translation.ko: 가족을 돕기 위해 애쓴다는 걸 알려 주고 싶었어요

translation.en: That's all I'm here for.
Whatever you got going on, unless it's pertinent to my case, I don't care.
translation.ko: 제 사건과 관련이 없다면 뭘 해도 상관없다고 했어요

translation.en: I'm here to try and solve this homicide for you and your family,
translation.ko: 당신들 가족을 위해 살인 사건을 해결하려는 거고

translation.en: and to put somebody who killed Crystal away.
So then, you know, we opened up a little more, but…
translation.ko: 그래서 조금 더 마음을 열긴 했지만…

translation.en: [Rick] There's a lot of rumors running around as to what might've happened.
translation.ko: 사건의 전말에 대해 여러 소문이 나돌고 있는데 "벨린다 레인 신문 기록"

translation.en: What are you thinking is…?
[Belinda] I'm thinking there's been a lot of gang problems with that, uh, 5150.
translation.ko: 5150 조직이 관련된 범죄가 많은 것 같아요

translation.en: [Rick] This is what we call the West End.
This kind of loop is where the actual shooting took place,
translation.ko: 바로 이 구역이 실제 총격이 벌어진 곳이고요

translation.en: but even more so where 5150 claim territory.
[Rick] But there were also multiple other gangs, Black, Hispanic,
translation.ko: 그 외에도 그곳을 자기 구역이라고 주장하는

translation.en: who laid claim to the same area.
So there's turf wars, and guys that see each other. There'll be conflict.
translation.ko: 구역 전쟁이 잦았고 조직끼리 분쟁이 있었죠

translation.en: [reporter] Rival Latino and Black gangs involved in drug trafficking…
translation.ko: 라이벌 관계인 라틴계와 흑인계 갱 조직이 마약 밀매에 연루돼…

translation.en: [Rick] 5150 kind of came into existence for us in Riverside around 2003, give or take.
They tried to establish themselves and made some inroads
into being a particularly violent and confrontational gang,
graduating to assaults, to shootings, to then, uh, murdering three people
translation.ko: 2년 반에서 3년 동안 그들의 범죄 행위는 여러 건의 폭행에서 총격으로

translation.en: within the city in the course of two and a half to three years.
translation.ko: 그리고 세 건의 살인으로 수위가 높아졌어요

translation.en: It was a very quick evolution.
[Mario] We're in Riverside now.
All kinds of shootings, and every night people will get stabbed, robbed.
translation.ko: 여긴 총격 사건이 빈번하고 밤마다 누군가는 칼에 찔리고 강도를 당해요

translation.en: As soon as people heard 5150, like, they got scared.
You know, they said we were murderers. We're killers.
Never once did I ever think that society would look at us like that.
translation.ko: 전 사람들이 우리를 그렇게 보는 줄 전혀 몰랐어요 "마리오 전 5150 조직원"

translation.en: Originally Riverside was, uh… It was kind of like an outcast from L.A.
translation.ko: 원래 리버사이드는 LA의 떨거지 같은 곳이죠

translation.en: All the people that couldn't afford to live in L.A. or in Orange County,
translation.ko: LA나 오렌지카운티에 살 형편이 못 되는 사람들이

translation.en: they came out to Riverside.
So a lot of, I would say poor people.
I don't think we ever even went to, like, the beach or Disneyland.
translation.ko: 해변이나 디즈니랜드에는 가본 적이 없는 거 같아요

translation.en: Nothing like that ever.
We never experienced anything outside of, like, that area.
translation.ko: 우리 동네 밖으로는 나가본 경험이 없어요

translation.en: So we thought that that was life.
Fifty-one, fifty, it was like me and my cousins or family members
translation.ko: 제게 5150이란 친척 같았고 서로 돌봐주는 가족 같았어요

translation.en: backing each other up. That was the whole motive.
translation.ko: 서로 돌봐주는 가족 같았어요 그게 중요했어요 우린 전부 한 가족이었어요

translation.en: Like, we're family. That was it.
translation.ko: 그게 중요했어요 우린 전부 한 가족이었어요

translation.en: We would all be out here.
Nothing really happening.
We were all under 18 years old, you know.
When we were kids, uh, you know, everybody targeted us.
translation.ko: 우린 아직 어렸고 다들 우릴 표적으로 삼았어요

translation.en: [Rick] Give me a full description of this--
[Belinda] He was young. He was young. He was a kid.
-But if I see him, I will know him. -[Rick] Okay.
translation.ko: - 얼굴을 보면 알 거 같아요 - 그렇군요

translation.en: [Belinda] Then there was more interviews and looking at pictures.
translation.ko: 계속되는 경찰 신문에 사진도 많이 보여줬어요

translation.en: [Rick] This particular binder has got all the different gang members.
translation.ko: 이 바인더에는 다양한 갱 조직원들이 있어

translation.en: And it kind of helps me to keep track of who's who in the zoo.
translation.ko: 누가 어떤 조직에 속했는지 아는 데 도움이 되죠

translation.en: I do remember Belinda telling me the shooter had been a really young,
translation.ko: 제가 기억하기로 벨린다는 범인이 아주 젊었고

translation.en: almost white-looking Hispanic guy, like a real baby face.
translation.ko: 제가 기억하기로 벨린다는 범인이 아주 젊었고 백인에 가까운 라틴계며 동안이었다고 했던 거 같아요

translation.en: She saw his face, and she'd absolutely be able to identify him.
translation.ko: 얼굴을 보면 누군지 분명히 알 수 있다고 했어요

translation.en: Wouldn't be a problem.
This is the sketch that was drawn based off the information provided by Belinda.
translation.ko: 이건 벨린다의 진술에 근거해 그린 용의자의 몽타주예요

translation.en: I looked through annuals, yearbooks,
looking for people who are gang members
and have a current picture I can look at.
I'm talking with Belinda, I say, "I got pictures I want you to look at."
translation.ko: 벨린다와 얘기하면서 제가 찾은 사진을 보여줬어요

translation.en: She starts going through the pictures.
And she gets to a young kid.
And she stops
and says, "That's him."
One day Detective Wheeler called and said that, uh,
they have somebody they think might be involved in it,
translation.ko: 사건과 관련된 사람을 찾은 것 같다면서

translation.en: and if they could drive me down there to get a look at him.
And she IDs him. "That's him. That's the guy."
[Rick] You doing okay, dude?
We start pressing him on this case and ask him where he was,
translation.ko: 사건에 대해 묻고 사건 당시 어디 있었는지 물어봤는데

translation.en: and he's given us a particular alibi as to where he was, who he was with.
translation.ko: 어디에 있었고 누구와 있었는지 꽤 구체적인 알리바이를 댔어요

translation.en: [suspect] I wasn't there.
[Rick] I know that you were, though. I got somebody who identified you.
translation.ko: 너 거기 있었단 거 알아 널 본 사람이 있거든

translation.en: I'm telling him, "We're gonna check this out."
"Don't lie. I'll find out if you're lying to me."
We were at my house, and then we went to his brother's girlfriend's house.
translation.ko: 우린 집에 같이 있다 걔네 형 여자친구 집에 갔어요

translation.en: [Ricky] He's saying, "I wasn't there."
"I was over at a friend's house. I was with a friend. You can call them."
translation.ko: 친구네 집에 있었으니까 친구 집에 직접 전화해

translation.en: "You can check with them." I get a couple of my partners
translation.ko: 확인해 보라고 하기에 제 동료 두어 명을 보내 알리바이를 확인했는데

translation.en: to go over and verify his alibi.
translation.ko: 제 동료 두어 명을 보내 알리바이를 확인했는데

translation.en: And it's solid.
[suspect crying] Please!
Let me go home! [crying] Let me go gome.
[Rick] So now I'm starting to think, "Uh-oh, I got a bad ID here?"
translation.ko: '엉뚱한 애를 잡은 건가?' 하는 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: "That's not a good start."
And we ended up sending him home.
They really didn't explain things to me well enough,
like you make one mistake and
translation.ko: 저한테 설명을 충분히 해주지 않아서 관련이 없는 사람을 실수로 잘못 지목하게 되면

translation.en: identify somebody that's not involved,
translation.ko: 관련이 없는 사람을 실수로 잘못 지목하게 되면

translation.en: they can no longer use what you have to say when it comes to court.
translation.ko: 나중에 법정에서 제 증언을 사용할 수 없다는 걸 몰랐어요

translation.en: So that complicated the case for the detective.
You start off with a case very optimistic.
We'll handle this. This is gonna get done.
translation.ko: 잘할 수 있고 해결할 거라 생각했는데

translation.en: Then you reach a point to where there aren't any more leads,
and… and now it's almost a war of attrition.
translation.ko: 더 이상 쫓을 단서가 없어졌고 지구력 싸움이 됐어요

translation.en: [Belinda] And I promised her.
It was the last thing I got to say to her, besides "I love you."
translation.ko: 사랑한다는 말 다음으로 마지막으로 한 말이었어요

translation.en: I promised her that I was gonna get him
if it's the last thing I do. I'm gonna get him. They're gonna pay.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 꼭 잡아 대가를 치르게 한다고요

translation.en: [Jaimie] I guess I was, uh, talking to Nick on MySpace,
and he had told me how the guys,
the people involved, had MySpace.
translation.ko: 마이스페이스를 한다고 했어요 "닉: 크리스털의 동생 제이미"

translation.en: He said, "They all have profiles."
[Nick] I pretty much, like, knew it was 5150 already.
translation.ko: 전 5150이 뭔지 이미 잘 알고 있었어요

translation.en: You know the streets talk, like, you just hear stuff.
translation.ko: 거리에 도는 말 있잖아요 저도 귀가 있어요

translation.en: I mean, little by little you find out.
I was young. I was just a kid when she passed away.
translation.ko: 전 어렸어요 누나가 죽었을 땐 아직 애였죠

translation.en: I was maybe 13 years old, so at that time when that happened,
translation.ko: 겨우 13살이었어요 그 일이 일어났을 땐 갱에 대해서 몰랐어요

translation.en: I didn't really know about gangs.
translation.ko: 그 일이 일어났을 땐 갱에 대해서 몰랐어요

translation.en: [Jaimie] I talked to Aunt Belinda. I said,
"MySpace. I can go on there. I can search for you."
"Get information for you."
[Belinda] I knew nothing about the social media. I wasn't on the MySpace.
translation.ko: 전 SNS에 대해 전혀 몰랐고 마이스페이스도 안 했어요

translation.en: She said, "How do you do it?" I said, "I can do it all. Don't worry."
translation.ko: 어떻게 하는 거냐고 물으셔서 제가 할 테니 걱정 마시라고 했죠

translation.en: I was 14.
About to turn 15.
[Lauer] If you've got a teenager at home,
chances are that he or she spends a lot of time
on the social networking website called MySpace.com.
translation.ko: SNS에 푹 빠져서 살 확률이 높습니다

translation.en: I knew everything about it. The ins and outs.
translation.ko: 전 그 사이트에 대해 속속들이 알았어요

translation.en: How to make it look like this, how to make this pop up in your text,
translation.ko: 어떻게 꾸미는지도 알았고 문자로 전송하는 방법과

translation.en: how to make colored text, everything.
[reporter] With 66 million users nationwide,
MySpace is one of the most popular networking sites used by kids.
translation.ko: 마이스페이스는 청소년들에게 가장 인기 있는 SNS 중 하나입니다

translation.en: Most of the kids at my school use MySpace.
You put pictures up. Meet girls, guys.
translation.ko: 거기 사진도 올리고 이성 친구도 만나요

translation.en: It was brand-new, popular. Everyone wanted to be on it.
translation.ko: 최신 유행으로 인기가 많아 너도나도 했어요

translation.en: I was obsessed with it.
I was excited. You want to give me this chance?
translation.ko: 정말 신났어요 제게 이런 기회를 주고 책임감을 줬다는 게요

translation.en: You want to give me responsibility?
translation.ko: 제게 이런 기회를 주고 책임감을 줬다는 게요

translation.en: I thought to myself, "How can I snoop better?"
translation.ko: 어떡하면 더 염탐을 잘할까 그 궁리만 했어요

translation.en: [Belinda] So Jaimie Googled a picture and found a pretty girl.
translation.ko: 제이미가 구글 검색으로 예쁜 여자 사진을 찾았어요

translation.en: [Jaimie] She had a Supergirl shirt on.
I was like, "You're gonna be my Supergirl."
I just wanted a pretty face, a pretty body,
translation.ko: 예쁜 얼굴과 멋진 몸매의 이 여자를

translation.en: and it was gonna be my brain behind it.
[Belinda] And we named her Rebecca, and we posted that up.
[Jaimie] I made her in the eyes of what I thought the gang members would like.
Added in, "Smoke weed, and I like to drink beer."
But I said cerveza because I thought it was more clever.
I wanted them to 100% think, "This girl on this MySpace is real."
translation.ko: 마이스페이스의 이 여자가 100% 진짜라고 믿게 하고 싶었어요

translation.en: I had the top eight.
I befriended all of them. Clicked on that person's profile,
translation.ko: '톱 8'에 그놈들을 전부 친구로 올렸어요 한 사람 프로필을 클릭하면 그 사람의 '톱 8'로 가고

translation.en: went to their top eight,
translation.ko: 한 사람 프로필을 클릭하면 그 사람의 '톱 8'로 가고

translation.en: added all of their top eight.
You got clicked, and everyone got clicked, and everyone got added,
translation.ko: 그럼 그쪽에서 나를 클릭하고 서로 친구로 추가했고

translation.en: and I just kept adding and adding until I had a MySpace full of guys

translation.ko: 계속 추가했더니 저도 꼭 조직원 같았어요

translation.en: I said, "Aunt Belinda, I got it set up. What do you want me to do?"
translation.ko: 벨린다 이모에게 준비됐으니 뭘 하면 되느냐고 물어봤더니

translation.en: "Get as much information as you can."
[Jaimie] I was making them like me. Just making them trust me.
[Belinda] They don't even spell a word out.
I had to ask, I go, "What does LOL mean?"
My typing was acting. That's what my acting was.
translation.ko: 제 글이 제 연기였어요 글로 연기를 했어요

translation.en: [Belinda] Just trying to find out where they were from, what they were doing.
translation.ko: 어디 출신인지, 무슨 일을 하는지 알아내라고 했어요

translation.en: Of course, I knew that they were driving a white Ford Expedition that night.
translation.ko: 저는 그날 밤 범인들이 흰색 포드 익스페디션을 몬 걸 알아요

translation.en: She wanted me to start prying for information real quick.
translation.ko: 이모는 제가 정보를 빨리 빼내기를 원하셨는데

translation.en: And I was like, "No, no, no, I gotta play it out."
"Let me do this in, like, a week."
Give me three days at least before I start being like,
translation.ko: 최소 3일은 지나야 이런 걸 물어볼 수 있잖아요

translation.en: "Hey, what car do you drive?"
Okay. He had the white Ford Expedition.
translation.ko: 됐어 범인은 흰색 포드 익스페디션을 몰았어요

translation.en: Yeah, two of them.
That even made it even more confusing too.
With the witnesses and everybody,
because the two vehicles the same color.
I… I remember at some point early on, we talked about the vehicles in the area.
translation.ko: 그곳에 나타난 차량에 대해 얘기한 기억이 나요

translation.en: Okay, this one's Robbie.
[Rick] Neighbors had seen a couple of vehicles.
Some described them as SUVs, like Expeditions or something of that nature.
translation.ko: 혹자는 익스페디션이나 그 비슷한 SUV로 묘사했어요

translation.en: They were parked right here.
[Rick] Doing laps in the area almost as if they were chasing each other.
translation.ko: 서로 추격하는 것처럼 이 동네를 돌고 있었어요

translation.en: I remember asking them about that. "You saw it? Know what happened?"
translation.ko: 이런 질문을 한 기억이 나요 '혹시 무슨 일인지 못 봤어요?'

translation.en: "You were getting in your cars to go somewhere else

And I can remember them
playing kind of dumb about it.
Yeah, there… there was a little bit. Um…
I didn't come forth with everything that I knew right away.
translation.ko: 당시에는 아는 것을 전부 솔직히 말하진 않았어요

translation.en: [Rick] Where was Robert when this happened?
[Belinda] Robert? I don't know. Robert had nothing to do with this.
translation.ko: 로버트요? 몰라요 걔는 이 일과 아무 관련 없어요

translation.en: [Rick] Sure. Sure.
translation.ko: 로버트요? 몰라요 걔는 이 일과 아무 관련 없어요 좋아요

translation.en: [interviewer] So you tell the story of that night, you don't mention Robbie.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 얘기를 하면서 로비 얘기는 안 하셨던데요

translation.en: [Belinda] Oh, yeah, because that had happened before,
translation.ko: 맞아요, 그 사건 전에 일이 있었는데 "로비 시어벌드 벨린다의 아들"

translation.en: but then that just kind of went out the door.
I mean, I wasn't even thinking about where Robbie went.
translation.ko: 로비가 어디에 갔는지 생각도 안 했어요

translation.en: I went to go find Robbie.
And we were getting ready to go to the store, and--
It turned out later on that the older brother, Robert,
translation.ko: 나중에 알고 보니 크리스털 오빠인 로버트가

translation.en: was actually one of the vehicles being chased,
translation.ko: 쫓기는 차량 중 한 대에 타고 있었는데

translation.en: and they didn't offer that up for quite a while.
[Rick] So this whole thing starts with Robbie
parked almost directly across from his parents' house, talking to a friend.
translation.ko: 부모님 집 맞은편에 주차하고 친구와 얘기할 때 시작됐어요

translation.en: I pulled up to his house, and, um, my buddy came out.
translation.ko: "로비 시어벌드 벨린다의 아들" 집 앞에 차를 세우니 친구가 나왔어요

translation.en: He's just in the passenger window talking to me.
translation.ko: 조수석 쪽 창을 통해 저와 얘기를 했죠

translation.en: And, uh, my girlfriend, she kind of got, like, she had a look on her face.
translation.ko: 그런데 제 여자친구가 이상한 표정을 지어서 보니

translation.en: And, uh, there was an Expedition behind us.
translation.ko: 익스페디션 한 대가 우리 뒤에 있었어요

translation.en: And I looked at my buddy, and he was kind of getting spooked,
translation.ko: 제 친구를 보니 겁에 질린 얼굴을 하고

translation.en: and kind of backpedaling back up to the house.
I did have an eerie feeling like I don't know these people. I don't…
translation.ko: 좀 섬뜩한 기분이 들었어요 잘 모르는 사람들과

translation.en: I don't have these problems in life, man, you know? Um…
I turned on my brights, and, uh, I just gunned it.
[Robbie] I thought I'd hit them or the curb,
translation.ko: 그 차를 박든 연석을 박든 나쁜 일이 터질 것 같아

translation.en: like something was bound to go wrong. And I slid around the corner.
translation.ko: 그 차를 박든 연석을 박든 나쁜 일이 터질 것 같아 차를 돌려 오는데

translation.en: And immediately they started chasing me.
[Rick] You were not in an SUV that night?
-[Robbie] No. -[Rick] Absolutely not?
I can't tell you how many people saw two SUVs that night.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 SUV를 본 사람이 한둘이 아니에요 로버트, 나는 당신 가족을 도우려는 거예요

translation.en: Realize, Robert, that I am here to help your family.
translation.ko: 로버트, 나는 당신 가족을 도우려는 거예요

translation.en: That's all our jobs.
[Robbie] I'm gone. I don't think it's an issue.
translation.ko: 전 거길 떠났고 아무 문제 없다고 생각했어요

translation.en: Whatever it was, it's gone.
I head over towards my daughter's mom's house.
And, uh, I get there, and I pull up, and she's all hysterical.
translation.ko: 거기 도착해 차를 세우니 애 엄마가 잔뜩 흥분해 있더군요

translation.en: [sighs] I think we started doing some follow-up on… the family.
translation.ko: 그때 가족에 대한 추가 조사를 시작한 것 같아요

translation.en: I learned that the Lane-Theobald family had some issues back in the day.
translation.ko: 당시 시어벌드 가족에게 문제가 좀 있단 걸 알게 됐어요

translation.en: People had been arrested, in prison.
translation.ko: 체포된 사람도 있고 감옥 간 사람도 있었죠

translation.en: My boys, you know, they're boys,
and they're going to have their problems,
and they like to fight, and whatever they do.
Even with Belinda, uh, there were drug issues in the past.
translation.ko: 그리고 벨린다도 과거에 마약 문제가 있었어요

translation.en: [Christy] We've been in the drug world together.
Using. But I don't want to say all that. Do you want me to say all that?
translation.ko: 그 얘기는 하긴 싫은데요 "크리스티 벨린다의 친구" 그 얘기를 하라고요?

translation.en: Well, you know, it started out a little weekend fun,
but then became mama's little helper.
It was like that's how you go to work and work two jobs,
and take care of five kids, and the house.
translation.ko: 애 다섯 키우며 집안일까지 해 봐요

translation.en: It was meth. Meth, the devil dope.
Go to work, take your line, you know? Come home from work. [scoffs]
translation.ko: 직장에 가서 일하고 일 마치면 집에 오고

translation.en: I mean, kids were always around, but not seeing.
translation.ko: 애들이 항상 곁에 있었지만 보지는 못했어요

translation.en: They weren't seeing that. We weren't doing drugs in front of the kids.
translation.ko: 애들은 못 봤어요 애들 앞에선 약을 안 했어요

translation.en: Uh…
They tried to hide it as much as they could,
but it was super obvious.
Yeah, then, the bigger issue was when I was selling drugs and went to prison.
translation.ko: 더 큰 문제는 제가 마약을 팔다 감옥에 갔을 때였어요

translation.en: [Rick] She's had dealings with the police in the past for her own issues,
translation.ko: 과거에 경찰과도 인연이 깊었어요 본인 문제와 아들들 문제로요

translation.en: for her son's issues.
Yeah. Yeah. I… I sold a lot. I did a lot of damage out there.
translation.ko: 네, 약을 많이 팔았어요 제가 좀 해를 많이 끼쳤죠

translation.en: All of Riverside, I… I did.
I've put a lot of drugs on the streets. A lot.
And all Crystal ever asked her, all the time when she was younger,
translation.ko: 크리스털이 어렸을 때 엄마에게 늘 하던 말이 있었어요

translation.en: was, "Mom, please, quit using. Please, please, please."
So now the idea of who might be responsible for this
opens up a little bit more.
That, is it something from somebody's past issues in prison?
translation.ko: 누가 교도소에서 과거에 저지른 일이 원인일까요?

translation.en: Is it somebody's past issues with gangs?
Is it somebody owed somebody money, or drugs, or, you know,
translation.ko: 아니면 누가 누구에게 약이나 돈을 빚진 걸까요?

translation.en: all of a sudden now the world of possibility opens up even further,
translation.ko: 피해자의 가족과 관련된 복잡한 상황 때문에

translation.en: because there's this compromising situation with the victim family.
translation.ko: 갑자기 가능성의 세계가 더 넓게 열렸어요

translation.en: [Jaimie] Every day. Get out of school, walk straight home.
translation.ko: 매일 학교를 마치면 집으로 곧장 와서

translation.en: Hours upon hours.
From three o'clock in the afternoon till one o'clock in the morning,
I'd be on there.
I think it got harder for me
translation.ko: 벨린다 이모가 크리스털 이름으로 마이스페이스 계정을

translation.en: when my Aunt Belinda came up with the idea of making Crystal a MySpace.
translation.ko: 벨린다 이모가 크리스털 이름으로 마이스페이스 계정을 만들자고 한 후 더 힘들어졌어요

translation.en: [Belinda] Rebecca just wasn't getting us enough hits
translation.ko: 우리가 관심 있는 자들이 리베카의 계정에

translation.en: from the ones that we were interested in.
And so I asked her, "Can you put Crystal's picture up there?"
translation.ko: 그래서 크리스털의 사진을 올려 줄 수 있느냐고 물었어요

translation.en: [Jaimie] I said, "Crystal. Why do you want to make Crystal a MySpace?"
translation.ko: 왜 크리스털의 계정을 만들고 싶은 건지 물었어요

translation.en: Make them fall in love with her.
[Belinda] We decided to name her Angel.
And I wrote on her profile
that I was going to be their biggest life mistake
and their deepest, darkest, best-kept secret.
And, boy, they just started responding.
It's like, boy, just left then right, ping, ping, ping.
I'd be on there switching back and forth. I'd have two pages open.
translation.ko: 저는 두 페이지를 열어 두고 왔다 갔다 했어요

translation.en: I would just minimize one, go to Angel, minimize the other, go to Rebecca.
translation.ko: 한 화면을 닫고 천사에게 갔다 그걸 닫고 리베카에게 갔죠

translation.en: My Supergirl. She wasn't making them fall in love.
translation.ko: 제 슈퍼걸은 남자들을 사랑에 빠지게 하진 못했어요

translation.en: She was more or less a booty call, you know?
Crystal was the love.
Rebecca pried a lot, was nosy.
Like, "Oh, tell me this, tell me that." It was very, very flirty.
And, like, teenager-y.
Like, "Oh, today was a shitty day." Like, "Uh, school sucks."
Like, a little sad face and stuff.
Angel's was always upbeat and sweet.
She had good fonts. She had big fonts.
translation.ko: 멋진 폰트를 썼고요 커다란 폰트도 있고

translation.en: Little fonts, pink fonts, blue fonts, sparkly fonts. [chuckling]
translation.ko: 작은 폰트도 있고, 분홍색 파란색, 반짝이 폰트도 있었어요

translation.en: [Belinda] It wasn't long.
translation.ko: 프로필 올린 지 얼마 안 됐을 때

translation.en: The profile had just barely been up when William Sotelo responded.
translation.ko: 프로필 올린 지 얼마 안 됐을 때 윌리엄 소텔로가 반응을 보였어요

translation.en: He doesn't watch movies. He watches porn.
He doesn't read books. It was, "eff books."
translation.ko: 책은 안 읽지만 야한 책은 읽는다더군요

translation.en: And he's standing in his profile.
"I'm from 5150, and I'm down to kill."
So I just got tunnel vision on Sotelo.
I mainly talked to him.
He was very adamant about 5150 on MySpace.
[Belinda] Jaimie's putting in messages. He's sending messages back.
translation.ko: 제이미가 메시지를 보내면 바로 답장이 왔어요

translation.en: "Well, what do you do besides party and drink?"
translation.ko: '파티하고 술 마시는 거 외에 또 뭐 해?'

translation.en: I'm not really the party girl, once in a while.
"No, no, no, that's not my thing. I have goals."
"I'll show you. I'm gonna be somebody."
When you want someone to want you, you play with them.
And I did what Crystal taught me to do, um, make the boy come to you.
translation.ko: 크리스털이 가르쳐 준 대로 남자가 나한테 오게 했어요

translation.en: [Belinda] We told him, uh, Angel's mom's in prison for cooking meth.
translation.ko: 천사는 엄마가 메스암페타민을 만들다 감옥에 갔다고 했어요

translation.en: And I thought maybe that'd get them to open up a bit about drugs or prison.
translation.ko: 마약이나 교도소에 대해 좀 털어놓게 하려고 했죠

translation.en: [Belinda] He came back opposite of what I would've thought.
translation.ko: "조크스: 저런 그런 일을 겪다니 안됐다" 제가 예상했던 것과 정반대로 반응했어요

translation.en: [Belinda] It got deep. It was like, "Wow."
translation.ko: "조크스: 힘든 거 알아 하루하루 버티면 좋아질 거야" 심오해졌어요, 저도 놀랐죠

translation.en: His messages, he was getting more sweet.
[Jaimie] How he wanted to give me the world
translation.ko: 내가 원하는 걸 다 해주고 싶고

translation.en: and make sure nothing else got in the way of it.
translation.ko: 아무도 그걸 못 막을 거라고 했어요

translation.en: [Jaimie] I have this picture of Crystal in my head.
[sniffs] I really had to portray that.
[voice breaks] I had to show him she was a beautiful person.
She was hard not to fall in love with.
You'd meet her, you'd fall in love with her.
[sniffles] Her personality, her smile.
It was hard not for that guy to fall in love with her.
translation.ko: 그놈은 크리스털과 사랑에 안 빠질 도리가 없었죠

translation.en: [Jaimie] He said, "Hey, girl, I'm having a party tonight. You want to come?"
translation.ko: 마침내 초대하더군요 '있잖아, 오늘 밤 파티에 올래?'

translation.en: [Belinda] "What's up? I'm ready tonight. You don't have a car, I'll come get you."
translation.ko: '안녕, 오늘 밤 준비 다 됐어 너 차 없으니까 태우러 갈게'

translation.en: We're like, no, no, no.
They wanna meet me. "What do I do?"
And she goes, "Well, well, tell him yes."
"And then send him a message, like, at the very last minute."
"And say you can't make it."
And then, like, an hour later, I was like, "Damn, I cannot find a ride."
translation.ko: 그러다 1시간 후쯤에 그랬어요 '태워다 줄 사람이 없어 못 가'

translation.en: He was so adamant about trying to get me to come out that night.
translation.ko: 소텔로는 그날 밤 날 오게 하려고 안달이 났어요

translation.en: It was more than he had ever tried before.
"Oh, girl. I'll come pick you up then."
So I was like, "Oh, so if you were to come pick me up,
translation.ko: 그래서 답을 했죠 '날 태우러 올 거면'

translation.en: what car am I supposed to look for?"
[Rick] That white truck, was there anything that stood out about it?
translation.ko: 그 흰색 트럭에 특별한 점은 없었어요?

translation.en: Like, was it lowered, or have some kind of special rims on it, anything at all?
translation.ko: 차체를 낮췄든지 림이 특별했다든지, 뭐 그런 거요?

translation.en: [Belinda] It was an Expedition. I don't know what make that is.
-[Rick] Okay. -[Belinda] If that's a Ford or what.
Belinda knew enough that I was looking for a particular kind of vehicle.
translation.ko: 벨린다는 제가 특정 차량을 찾고 있다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: An Expedition.
It was a white color, but it also had some gold accent here and there.
translation.ko: 흰색에 여기저기 금색으로 엑센트를 준 차요

translation.en: And I was looking for the 5150 gang member who had that car.
translation.ko: 전 그 차를 가진 5150의 조직원을 찾고 있었어요

translation.en: I went ahead and called Detective Wheeler and told him,
"Look, this is what I found out, and I think we found him."
translation.ko: '제가 알아낸 정보예요' '범인을 찾은 거 같아요 이놈들이 맞아요'

translation.en: "This is who they are."
[Rick] I remember her calling me saying, "Jokes. It was his car."
"Jokes drove that car. It was him."
That's also where the MySpace account started to come into play. Um…
translation.ko: 그때부터 마이스페이스 계정이 수사에 끼어들기 시작했어요

translation.en: At the beginning, I told her,
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 이렇게 말했죠 '시작할 때 저한테'

translation.en: "I wish you would've told me you were starting this."
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 이렇게 말했죠 '시작할 때 저한테' '얘기하시지 그랬어요 그럼 미리 알았을 텐데요'

translation.en: "So I would've known ahead of time."
But, uh, rolling through the comments from these various guys
translation.ko: 수많은 남자가 남긴 코멘트를 죽 훑어보니

translation.en: that were just head over heels for this girl.
I mean, they… A pretty lady, a pretty girl,
and her talking to them the way that, that she was.
It was no wonder they got lured in. It's a great way to set it up.
So my next thought is, I got to get a hold of William Sotelo, Jokes.
translation.ko: 윌리엄 소텔로, 즉 조크스를 만나야겠다고 생각했어요

translation.en: If he in fact is the driver, he should be able to tell me who else was in the car.
translation.ko: 그자가 운전자였다면 누가 그 차에 같이 타고 있었는지 누가 총을 쐈는지 말해줄 수 있을 거 같았어요

translation.en: He should be able to tell me who the shooter is.
translation.ko: 누가 총을 쐈는지 말해줄 수 있을 거 같았어요

translation.en: [Rick] Okay. All right, Will.
translation.ko: "5150 조직원 윌리엄 소텔로 일명 '조크스'의 신문 기록" 그래요, 그러죠

translation.en: We'll get you right back here once we're all finished up.
He was in the Job Corps.
You're doing your GED. I know what that means.
-What are you doing as far as the cooking? -[Will] Pantry cook.
translation.ko: - 요리 관련 일은 뭘 해? - 조리사 보조예요

translation.en: [Rick] He was supposedly studying to be a chef.
That's cool, man. That's better than what you were doing.
translation.ko: 그거 멋지다 전에 하던 일보단 낫네

translation.en: -[Will] Yeah. -[Rick] Big time.
We talked all the way back from San Bernardino to Riverside.
translation.ko: 샌버나디노에서 리버사이드까지 오는 내내 대화를 나눴죠

translation.en: All right. You wanted a water? See if you can get one for him?
translation.ko: 물 마시고 싶댔지? 물 좀 갖다줄 수 있나?

translation.en: -Sorry about that. -[Will] No problem.
Your name has popped up in a case that I'm working. Okay?
translation.ko: 내 담당 사건에서 네 이름이 나왔거든

translation.en: -Case? -[Rick] Yeah.
In an investigation that I'm doing.
What is it? Gang members, or…?
[Rick] Well, it's got to do with 5150.
There's a girl that got shot.
-Girl? -[Rick] Mm-hm.
The thing that I need to ask you about, though, is your… your car.
translation.ko: 너한테 물어보고 싶은 건 네 차에 관한 거야

translation.en: Your Ford Expedition was identified as being there.
translation.ko: 네 포드 익스페디션이 범죄 현장에 있었거든

translation.en: [Will] Was it mine? With the license plates? I don't know.
[Rick] Yeah, your car was there.
-Uh-huh. -[Rick] And…
-When was this? -[Rick] Back in February.
-Back in February? -[Rick] Mm-hm.
I don't know.
[Rick] Yeah, you do, man.
When he would give me things that were denials
or, um, he'd refute evidence I had, I would just keep pushing him back into,
translation.ko: 제가 내민 증거를 무시해도 계속 밀어붙였어요

translation.en: "It's not a question of whether you were there. I know you were there."
translation.ko: '네가 있었냐 없었냐를 묻는 게 아냐' '넌 거기 분명히 있었고 난 이유를 알고 싶어'

translation.en: "I want to know why."
translation.ko: '넌 거기 분명히 있었고 난 이유를 알고 싶어'

translation.en: Nobody else in 5150 or anyone else in that area drives that car but you.
translation.ko: 5150 조직원 중에서 그 차를 모는 사람은 너뿐이잖아

translation.en: Every time I talk about Jokes, it's always that car.
translation.ko: 조크스 얘기가 나오면 그 차 얘기가 항상 나오던데

translation.en: -Jokes? Uh-huh. -[Rick] Uh-huh. That's you.
Now is the time that you really need to be straight up with me
translation.ko: 지금 나한테 솔직하게 말하는 게 좋을 거야

translation.en: because I am your only ally right now.
I think after a while that wore him down.
The problem is if you sit and tell me, "I wasn't there…"
translation.ko: 여기 앉아서 계속 거기 없었다고만 하면…

translation.en: All right, like, I'll say the truth, but--
[Rick] That's what I want you to tell me. The truth.
translation.ko: 그게 내가 원하는 거야 사실대로 말해

translation.en: I wasn't involved in it. It just happened.
translation.ko: 난 그 일과 상관없어요 그냥 일어났어요

translation.en: [Rick] Tell me. Tell me what happened.
[Will] I don't know. We were just cruising.
translation.ko: "총격 사건 7분 전" 러틀랜드 근처를 차로 돌아다니고 있었어요

translation.en: Like, driving around by Rutland.
[Rick] Rutland Park? Is that 5150 territory,
or isn't that close to MD territory?
[Will] Yes, that's MD's territory.
[Rick] And everybody's piled into your Expedition?
[Will] It was full, probably like seven people in the car.
translation.ko: 차에 탄 사람은 7명 정도 됐을 거예요

translation.en: This white Expedition passed quick, almost hit my truck.
translation.ko: 그런데 흰색 익스페디션이 지나가다 제 차를 박을 뻔했죠

translation.en: He cuts us off, like, whoosh.
Almost, like, this close to hitting the truck.
"This is where we were when we saw the SUV Robert was driving."
"This is where we stopped when the cars drove up on us."
translation.ko: '여기서 차를 세웠는데 차 두 대가 우리 쪽으로 왔어요'

translation.en: And then they started…
The… The white Expedition started shooting at the car, at my truck.
translation.ko: 갑자기 흰색 익스페디션에서 제 차에 대고 총을 쐈어요

translation.en: -[Rick] They shot at your truck? -[Will] Yeah.
I was gonna take off, and Lil Huero's like, "Just stop."
translation.ko: 전 그냥 가려고 했는데 릴 우에로가 차를 세우라 하더니

translation.en: -He got out. -[Rick] Okay.
So Little Huero gets out, right?
translation.ko: 리틀 우에로가 내렸다고? "훌리오 에레디아 일명 릴 우에로"

translation.en: Where did he walk to? Did he walk to--?
I don't know. I started ducking. There was bullets everywhere.
translation.ko: 몰라요, 전 머리를 숙였어요 사방에 총알이 날아다녔거든요

translation.en: [Rick] That's pretty ballsy to get out if somebody is shooting at you.
translation.ko: 누가 총을 쏘는데 나가다니 배짱이 두둑한데

translation.en: Pretty ballsy to get out of the car.
He's crazy. He's psycho. It's weird.
[Rick] What did you see in the car with the girl inside when it went by?
-I don't know. -Did it look like it got hit?
-It did. -[Rick] It have bullet holes in it?
No, like the window was shattered.
[Rick] Which window?
The front… The front, like, um, passenger side.
[Rick] Okay.
And you said you were getting shot at? Did your car get hit?
translation.ko: 네 쪽으로 쐈다고 했는데 네 차도 총에 맞았어?

translation.en: No. Um, I don't think it got hit.
[Rick] That's close for them not to hit you.
translation.ko: 그렇게 가까운 거리인데 어떻게 못 맞혔지?

translation.en: -I'd have thought you've been hit. -I don't know.
[Rick] And we had no bullet strikes in William's SUV, no shell casings,
translation.ko: 윌리엄의 SUV에는 총알 자국이 없었고 탄피도 못 찾았어요

translation.en: no weapons that were found within the Theobald household.
And lacking that evidence, I don't have anything to substantiate
translation.ko: 그런 증거가 없으니 시어벌드네 사람 누군가가 총을 쐈다고 단정할 수는 없었죠

translation.en: that they were fired at by the Theobald family.
translation.ko: 시어벌드네 사람 누군가가 총을 쐈다고 단정할 수는 없었죠

translation.en: Okay, when did you see Little Huero again?
translation.ko: 그럼 리틀 우에로는 언제 다시 봤어?

translation.en: I never saw him. I never heard from him or saw him ever again.
translation.ko: 그 후로는 보지도 못했고 소식도 못 들었어요

translation.en: -[Rick] No? -Mm-mm.
[Rick] They had not had contact with him, Julio Heredia.
They hadn't seen him. He wasn't out doing the crimes that he'd been doing.
translation.ko: 보지도 못했고 전에 저지르던 범죄도 안 저지른다더군요

translation.en: He was kind of a ghost.
So, Little Huero, Julio Heredia,
translation.ko: 그래서 리틀 우에로 즉 훌리오 에레디아가

translation.en: he's definitely looking like a prime suspect.
I need to find him. I need to get ahold of him.
Why don't we take a break? Mind hanging out for a few minutes?
translation.ko: 잠깐 쉬었다 할까? 혼자 좀 있을래?

translation.en: -Okay. -[Rick] Okay, be right back.
-Is this, like, all gonna stay here? -[Rick] What's that?
Is anybody else going to find out about this?
translation.ko: 이 일에 대해 누가 알게 되면 어쩌죠?

translation.en: -[Rick] Am I gonna go run and tell? -I don't wanna get killed.
translation.ko: - 내가 나가서 말할까 봐? - 전 죽기 싫어요

translation.en: [Rick] I ain't gonna tell Little Huero about it.
translation.ko: - 리틀 우에로한테 말 안 해 - 알았어요

translation.en: [Rick] I didn't have enough for an arrest for William at that point.
And since everything was on his willingness to help me out, legally,
translation.ko: 이 모든 건 합법적으로 윌리엄이 기꺼이 돕기로 한 거라

translation.en: I was going to have to let him go at the end of it. Um…
because I promised him I would.
-San Bernadino or--? -Could you drop me off at Parkview?
[Rick] Parkview? I can do that.
But he was huge. Very big piece.
This is the matrix covering the different people also at the homicide, at the scene when it happened.
translation.ko: 이게 바로 살인 현장에 있던 모든 사람을 다 담은 거예요

translation.en: Um, this is William Lemus Junior, and his nickname was Little Rascal.
translation.ko: 이쪽이 윌리엄 레무스 주니어 일명 리틀 래스컬이라고

translation.en: And his brother Manuel.
Manuel's nickname was Tripper.
[Manuel] I felt like it was just bullshit.
At school, gangs were aiming for little kids,
to take them in when they were little.
I wasn't with it. I told them, "They're too young."
translation.ko: 전 걔들이 너무 어리니 데려오지 말자고 했는데

translation.en: And they looked at me and said, "How do you think we got you in?"
[Manuel] I went to their house party, and I liked everything that they did.
translation.ko: 집에서 하는 파티에 갔는데 걔들이 하는 게 다 좋아 보였어요

translation.en: And that house was full of people.
Loud music playing.
But at that moment, I felt like this is where I wanted to be.
translation.ko: 그 순간은 나도 그곳에 있고 싶다고 생각했어요

translation.en: Next thing you know, I got a guy in a bike coming up to me.
translation.ko: 그런데 오토바이를 타고 온 어떤 애가 제게 다가왔어요

translation.en: I remember beginning of school year,
somebody said that the guy on the bike is the one that shoots you.
translation.ko: 오토바이 타고 다니는 애가 사람들을 쏘고 다닌다고요

translation.en: Julio.
He's like, "Right on. Give him a beer."
I don't drink.
"Do you want to be in, or no?"
"Yeah."
"Get him some weed."
"I don't smoke."
"You want to be in? Do this. You want to be in? Do that."
Puts up his hand and said, "Get him."
[Manuel] One of the kids grabbed me, tackled me to the floor,
translation.ko: 그러자 한 놈이 저를 잡더니 공격해 넘어뜨리고

translation.en: speared me to the floor down.
And then, like, you're in.
And they just started hugging me, holding me.
"We'll get your back whenever anything happens."
translation.ko: '무슨 일이 생기면 네 뒤는 우리가 봐줄게'

translation.en: Next thing in school, they want me to hang out with them.
They want me to be around their table.
And then I was like, "Hey, I'm making it in now."
The way I felt was,
"Why should I be scared?"
translation.ko: "훌리오 에레디아 일명 릴 우에로" '겁낼 거 뭐 있어? 오히려 안전한 거지'

translation.en: "Shouldn't I feel safe?"
translation.ko: '겁낼 거 뭐 있어? 오히려 안전한 거지'

translation.en: Have that feeling that no one will come after me.
I'm with the ones that come after people.
We lived very peacefully there. Very peacefully.
There were never any problems, nothing, nothing.
translation.ko: "베티 레무스 마누엘의 어머니" 전혀 아무 문제도 없었어요

translation.en: All those guys were his friends because they were all from the same neighborhood.
translation.ko: 걔들은 다 같은 동네 출신 친구들이었어요

translation.en: They were his friends.
They seemed so innocent.
They showed me respect. They didn't use bad language.
translation.ko: 저한테 예의를 지켰고 욕 같은 것도 안 했어요

translation.en: And I had no idea what a big problem that was.
translation.ko: 전 그게 큰 문제란 것도 전혀 몰랐어요

translation.en: It wasn't done yet. That's why I stayed on for so long.
translation.ko: 끝난 게 아니었어요 그래서 오래 있었던 거죠

translation.en: That's why I never got off
because I still had a lot more to do.
[Jaimie] I really tried to be Crystal.
Making someone fall in love with someone who's dead is not a good feeling inside.
translation.ko: 누군가가 죽은 사람을 사랑하게 하는 건 썩 유쾌한 일은 아니에요

translation.en: When I was messaging as Angel…
pretending to be her,
I was really, really keeping her alive in my heart.
translation.ko: 정말 크리스털이 내 마음속에 살아있는 거 같았어요

translation.en: I was with her again all night long.
Staying up late.
I think that's what made it difficult at the end.
It just… It felt like I was…
stuck pretending to be her.
She wasn't here anymore. It was hard to look at her face every day.
translation.ko: 크리스털은 없는데 매일 얼굴 보는 게 힘들었어요

translation.en: [Jaimie] That's when the MySpace got hard for me.
I said I was done.
I couldn't do it anymore.
Oh, yeah, I was so… I was very depressed, very depressed. Uh…
I said, "Why isn't William Sotelo in custody?"
translation.ko: 윌리엄 소텔로를 체포 안 한 게 의아했어요

translation.en: After they find out everything, and he admits to it.
[Justin] Everything has a breaking point, sooner or later.
Like a jar, all this stuff going in.
There's no release valve. It just keeps going in,
translation.ko: 나오는 곳은 없는데 계속 쑤셔 넣기만 하면

translation.en: and the jar is starting to crack.
And stuff's starting to come out with nowhere to go.
translation.ko: 달리 갈 데가 없으면 결국은 새어 나오죠

and stop at the intersection of Greenpoint and Geranium.
Two vehicles drive up to their car that has stopped
translation.ko: 그때 차 두 대가 접근하더니 멈춘 곳이

translation.en: almost in the middle of the intersection.
And they thought that this was rival gang members coming to attack them.
translation.ko: 훌리오 일행은 라이벌 갱단이 공격하러 온 줄 알았죠

translation.en: [Manuel] Julio gets out of the SUV, and walks in the middle of the road.
translation.ko: 훌리오는 SUV에서 내려 길 한가운데를 걸어갔어요

translation.en: By that moment, he's pulling out his piece
and just fired away.
The one round that struck Crystal caught her in the back of the head,
translation.ko: 총알 하나가 크리스털 머리 뒤에 명중했어요

translation.en: kind of just around the neckline.
And, um, that would've been one of the final rounds that was fired as the vehicle's leaving the area.
translation.ko: 차가 그곳을 뜨면서 발사한 마지막 몇 발 중 하나였을 거예요

translation.en: And then four blocks ahead, we see it pull over.
We already knew someone got hit.
-[Rick] Out, like outside? -[Manuel] Yeah.
-Lil Huero. -[Rick] Just Lil Huero?
-Just him. -[Rick] Okay.
[Rick] I developed a rapport with William Lemus and Manuel,
translation.ko: 윌리엄, 마누엘 형제와는 신뢰 관계가 형성됐고

translation.en: to where I feel like they trusted that I had their best interests at heart.
translation.ko: 이 둘도 제가 도우려고 한다는 걸 느낀 것 같아요

translation.en: I stood up, and I turned around so he could see from behind. I wasn't wearing a wire.
translation.ko: 일어서서 돌아섰어요 도청 장치 안 한 거 보여주려고요

translation.en: And they could be my very key witnesses in this case.
He'd be on the passenger side, but in the seat behind.
translation.ko: 그 친구는 조수석 뒷자리에 앉아 있었단 거지, 좋아

translation.en: [Rick] That pushed everything into the area
translation.ko: 결국 이 사건은 법정까지 가게 될 것 같았어요

translation.en: that this will end up in a courtroom. Somebody's gonna be held responsible.
translation.ko: 결국 이 사건은 법정까지 가게 될 것 같았어요 누군가는 책임을 지게 됐어요

translation.en: [officer] Police Department! Search warrant!
translation.ko: "2007년 8월 8일 크리스털 사망 18개월 후" 경찰이다! 수색 영장을 갖고 왔다!

translation.en: [Rick] We ended up doing a large gang sweep with a whole bunch of agencies.
translation.ko: 여러 기관과 공조해 대규모 갱 소탕 작전을 벌였어요

translation.en: [reporter] Police carried out gang association search warrants.
translation.ko: 경찰은 수요일에 갱 조직에 대한 수색 영장을 집행했습니다

translation.en: Somewhere in the neighborhood of 25 to 30 houses were hit all at the same time
on a particular morning.
[reporter] "This was a reign of terror," said the D.A.
translation.ko: 지방 검사는 이렇게 말했습니다 '지금은 공포의 시대입니다'

translation.en: "I think we took the gang apart on Wednesday."
[Rick] The guys that were working the intel for Julio Heredia
called and said, "We've got a line on where he's at."
Julio woke up one day surrounded with cops.
translation.ko: 훌리오가 어느 날 아침 일어나니 경찰이 에워싸고 있었는데

translation.en: And they were Mexican cops.
I'm wanting to say it was within a day. I think we got him up here.
translation.ko: 하루 만에 훌리오를 미국으로 데려온 거 같아요

translation.en: Today we take back our park, our streets, our neighborhood,
translation.ko: 오늘 우리는 우리의 공원과 거리 동네와 우리 지역 사회를 되찾아

translation.en: and a part of our community and return it to the rightful owners.
translation.ko: 동네와 우리 지역 사회를 되찾아 온당한 주인에게 돌려줬습니다

translation.en: [Belinda] There's no justice. Justice would be
translation.ko: 정의는 안 이뤄졌어요 정의가 이뤄지려면 크리스털이 우리에게 돌아와야죠

translation.en: if they could find a way to bring Crystal back to us.
News vans rolled up. I was just, like, wow.
[reporter] Her engagement on social media gleaned information
that eventually helped lead police to arrests.
translation.ko: 경찰이 범인을 체포하는 데 도움을 줬습니다

translation.en: [Belinda] We were notified the night before
that Julio Heredia had been charged with my daughter's murder,
translation.ko: 훌리오 에레디아를 우리 딸 살해범으로 체포해

translation.en: and that he was in custody.
It was like, "Thank you, Jesus. Thank you. They got him. They got him."
[Rick] You're looking at a murder charge, and you're that…
translation.ko: 넌 살인 혐의로 체포됐어 진짜 넌 죄가 없다는 거야?

translation.en: Are you that confident? I'm looking at you.
translation.ko: 넌 살인 혐의로 체포됐어 진짜 넌 죄가 없다는 거야? 내가 보기엔 별로 자신 있는 얼굴은 아닌데

translation.en: I can tell you're not confident.
translation.ko: 내가 보기엔 별로 자신 있는 얼굴은 아닌데

translation.en: No, I'm sure about this. I'm thinking about other things.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 난 확실해요 다른 생각 하느라 그래요

translation.en: [Rick] What are you thinking about? Anna?
-That kid she's carrying? -Yup.
[Rick] There's a lot of stuff in your life right now.
How far along is she now?
-Four months. -[Rick] Four months?
-Little boy or little girl? Do you know? -No.
[Rick] How is she doing?
She's good.
[Rick] You got a four-month-old on the way.
Set the example and step up and be a man about this.
translation.ko: 모범을 보여야지 남자답게 인정할 건 해

translation.en: You made a mistake. Everybody makes mistakes.
translation.ko: 넌 실수한 거고 누구나 실수는 해

translation.en: Some of them are bigger than others.
But right here, right now is the chance for you to make a change.
translation.ko: 하지만 지금 이 순간 넌 그걸 바꿀 수 있어

translation.en: For you to be a different kind of a person, Julio.
translation.ko: 넌 다른 사람이 될 수 있어 훌리오

translation.en: You want to sleep on it tonight?
No, I just want to… Yeah, I want a freaking lawyer.
I want you to give me my rights. I want somebody to be right here.
translation.ko: 나도 권리가 있잖아요 날 도움 사람이 필요해요

translation.en: [Rick] Now you want a lawyer? You can have an attorney if you want.
translation.ko: 변호사를 불러 달라고? 원한다면 변호사 불러 줄게

translation.en: You wanna do that? That's fine.
-But now you got a lot to think about. -You don't understand me anyways.
translation.ko: - 잘 생각해야 할 거야 - 형사님들은 날 이해 못 해요

translation.en: [Diallo] I would describe Riverside as kind of the Wild West
translation.ko: "국선 변호인 사무소" 리버사이드는 사법 제도 면에선 무법의 서부예요

translation.en: of the criminal justice system as far as here in Southern California.
translation.ko: 리버사이드는 사법 제도 면에선 무법의 서부예요 "솔리 디알로 훌리오의 변호사" 특히 남캘리포니아에선 변호사 하기 힘들죠

translation.en: An intense place to practice.
The DA's office, they have a reputation.
You know, we're aggressive about gang prosecutions.
So aggressive to the fact we're looking to put gang members to death.
translation.ko: 사형 선고 가능 재판을 밀어붙일 만큼 공격적이었죠

translation.en: You know, on our side we're representing Julio,
and trying to convey his humanity and his interests,
but they have to have a tough decision to a family who's lost somebody.
translation.ko: 가족을 잃은 누군가에게는 견디기 힘들 수도 있어요

translation.en: [Rick] Now we bring the family in,
and we talk with the DA's office about if it'll be the death penalty.
translation.ko: 사형 선고 가능 재판 여부에 대해 검사와 의논했어요

translation.en: I know Belinda was very, very passionate.
She wanted him to pay the ultimate price for it.
Um, and I don't blame her. I don't blame her at all.
translation.ko: 그 마음 이해해요 충분히 이해하고도 남죠

translation.en: [Belinda] Yeah, I hate him. I hate him.
I do.
There's… I can't think of anything in the world bad enough
translation.ko: 이 세상에서 가장 심한 벌이라 해도

translation.en: that would be enough.
Capital cases, your whole mind frame is changed to saving a person's life.
translation.ko: 사형 선고 가능 재판에는 한 사람의 생명을 구한단 생각으로 임해야 합니다

translation.en: So that person's entire life has to be investigated
translation.ko: 그 사람 인생 전체를 조사해야 해요

translation.en: because ultimately, you're not just killing
translation.ko: 그 죄를 저지른 부분만 죽이는 게 아니라

translation.en: that part of the person that committed the crime. You're killing all of them.
translation.ko: 그 죄를 저지른 부분만 죽이는 게 아니라 그 사람 전체를 죽이는 거니까요

translation.en: Their story has to be told. How they got to where they were.
translation.ko: 어떻게 그렇게 됐는지 모든 얘기를 들어야 해요

translation.en: You know, not excuses but explanations.
[chuckles] He was so small in this picture.
He was so tiny.
His big, old ears.
I remember them sending us out.
The papers that we have to fill out, like if you're 18 and older,
translation.ko: "아말리아 훌리오의 동생" 서류를 보내준 게 기억나요 18세 이상이면

translation.en: and if you want to go to the execution, you can.
translation.ko: 사형 집행을 보러 갈 수 있거든요

translation.en: Oh, my mom.
It was hard living with my mom.
You know, she was on drugs and alcohol, and…
I mean, I would pick stuff up off the floor, eating it
translation.ko: 전 너무 배가 고파 바닥에 떨어진 음식을

translation.en: 'cause we were so hungry.
So that brings… Seeing this picture brings back a lot of bad memories.
translation.ko: 이 사진을 보니까 나쁜 기억이 많이 떠올라요

translation.en: We didn't have food. We didn't have furniture.
Julio, he had to take care of all of us, getting money, working.
translation.ko: 훌리오가 일하고 돈 벌어 가족 모두를 부양해야 했죠

translation.en: For me, the only father figure I ever had was Julio.
[Mario] You know, with Julio, we looked up to him.
We wanted to be like him. We would dress like him. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 훌리오처럼 되고 싶어 옷도 똑같이 입었어요

translation.en: You know, we were proud.
We would go to school, and we'd tell everybody, "That's our cousin."
This is where we lived up here, and he lived over there across the street.
translation.ko: 여기가 우리가 살던 집이고 훌리오는 건너편에 살았어요

translation.en: That was his last spot where, like, he actually, like, lived with his mom.
translation.ko: 저기가 훌리오가 엄마와 살았던 마지막 집이었어요

translation.en: Uh, Julio was 14, 15, then.
I think he couldn't accept that his mom just didn't care to get them back.
translation.ko: 엄마가 자식들을 되찾으려 하지 않는 걸 못 받아들인 거 같아요

translation.en: You know, she didn't try to get them back.
See, this picture just reminds me, like, of when they started,
translation.ko: 이 사진을 보면 처음으로 훌리오가 거리에 나가

translation.en: you know, going out and getting involved in all that stuff.
translation.ko: 그 패거리와 어울리기 시작한 게 기억나요

translation.en: [Mario] He started hanging out with the older guys.
And those are guys who would let him in his house. And they gave him drugs.
translation.ko: 그 사람들이 집에도 초대하고 마약도 주고 했어요

translation.en: And, you know, uh, they started having him do things
that he shouldn't have been doing.
Oh, this has everybody in it.
They all look so young in this picture.
[Mario] This guy stabbed him with this huge kitchen knife.
translation.ko: 어떤 남자가 커다란 주방용 칼로 훌리오를 찔렀는데

translation.en: And Julio's skinny, so the knife, like, came out his back.
translation.ko: 훌리오가 너무 말라 칼이 등으로 나왔어요

translation.en: That's when I started realizing he wasn't, um, the same anymore.
translation.ko: 그때 훌리오가 예전과 다르단 걸 깨달았어요

translation.en: Like, his joy was gone. It was, like, done, dead.
translation.ko: 훌리오 인생에서 기쁨은 다 사라져 버렸다는 걸요

translation.en: Nick even said, "Mom, I don't like this fucker."
translation.ko: 닉이 이랬어요 '엄마, 난 이 새끼 싫어요'

translation.en: He goes, "Yeah, I fucking don't like him."
"But, Mom, you got to think, when I was 17, I didn't give a fuck."
[Nick] I was into sports.
I mean, playing football and going to ride my dirt bike.
translation.ko: 전 스포츠를 좋아했어요 축구도 하고 더트 바이크도 탔어요

translation.en: And after Crystal was killed, I started having problems at school with fighting,
translation.ko: 축구도 하고 더트 바이크도 탔어요 크리스털이 죽고 나서는 학교에서 자주 싸움질을 했어요

translation.en: in a bad mood, and mad at the world, I guess I could say.
And he started messing up. He was angry. He wanted revenge.
translation.ko: 말썽을 많이 피웠죠 화가 나서 복수를 원했어요

translation.en: And we were losing him to a gang.
-[interviewer] Which son? -Nicholas.
Yeah, like, I was from a gang, and we were enemies with the 5150s and stuff.
translation.ko: 네, 5150과 적대 관계에 있는 갱단에 들어갔었어요

translation.en: I just fit in right with them.
Like, fuck them fools too, you know? Like let's go look for them and…
[Belinda] Now I have the fear and worry about my son being killed in gang violence
translation.ko: 이제 전 아들이 갱 싸움에 휘말려 죽을까 걱정됐어요

translation.en: and being a part of a gang, or killing somebody.
translation.ko: 갱 조직원이 돼 사람을 죽이는 것도요

translation.en: [Nick] When I was a juvenile, I was arrested a lot.
translation.ko: 청소년 시절에 여러 번 체포되기도 했어요

translation.en: I mean, I have the gun case, then I'm up for assault with a firearm.
translation.ko: 총기 사건도 있고 무기를 소지한 폭행 사건도 있고요

translation.en: That's what I got out of prison for, and it's just not worth it.
translation.ko: 그런 일로 감옥에 갔는데 그럴 가치가 없었어요

translation.en: You stay in denial a little bit.
You don't wanna believe that your child…
could do something like that. Get a gun.
I'm like, "How did you get a gun? Where did you get a gun?"
translation.ko: 제가 물었죠, '총 어떻게 구했어? 총이 어디서 났어?'

translation.en: This was my bottom.
This…
This was Belinda's wake-up call.
I had to really start taking a good look at myself,
and why I was having all of these… these feelings,
and just being pissed off at the world.
And… where is the anger coming from?
What… What is it I'm mad at?
Well, I was mad at me. I was mad at me.
I was disappointed in me.
Who's that? You guys, get down!
I think they're coming up the road again. Get behind the car, Ben. Hurry!
translation.ko: 이쪽으로 돌아오는 것 같은데 차 뒤로 가, 벤, 어서!

translation.en: [dispatcher] Wait. Ma'am, hold on. Do you think he was a teenager?
translation.ko: 잠깐만요, 부인 범인이 십 대라고 생각해요?

translation.en: [Belinda] The last day I used was the day Crystal was murdered.
translation.ko: 크리스털이 살해된 날 밤 약을 끊었어요

translation.en: Yeah. I was high.
-He was shorter than me. -[dispatcher] Thin, medium, heavy build?
Oh gosh, uh…
And that's all Crystal ever wanted from me.
translation.ko: 크리스털이 제게 바란 건 그게 다였어요

translation.en: "Mom, just get sober."
My heart's still pounding. I'm just like, "Oh my God. I can't believe this."
And I couldn't do it for her. I couldn't do it for her in life.
translation.ko: 걔가 살아있을 때 그걸 못 해줬어요

translation.en: I have to learn to forgive myself.
And that's harder than forgiving… Julio Heredia.
It really is.
I had to say that.
[woman] Just memorials of all the murders in Riverside County.
translation.ko: "피해자의 목소리를 듣습니다" 리버사이드 카운티에서 일어난 살인 사건은…

translation.en: [Belinda] Every single day, it's on the news.
It's just the names are changing.
I can understand where the drugs, gangs,
translation.ko: 갱 조직원들이 마약 하는 거 알아요

translation.en: and they were all high as a kite that night too.
translation.ko: 그날 밤 다 약에 취해 있었겠죠

translation.en: I can actually say, "There go I, but for the grace of God."
translation.ko: 신의 은총이 없었다면 저도 그 애들처럼 됐을 거예요

translation.en: That was really the reason that we asked him to take the death penalty off the table.
translation.ko: 그래서 사형은 배제해 달라고 부탁했던 거고요

translation.en: I did the right thing for the first time in my life.
translation.ko: 평생 처음 옳은 일을 한 거죠

translation.en: I did the right thing. Yeah.
If you've got gang members that are definitely loyal to their gang
translation.ko: 갱 조직에 몸담고 있으면 충성하게 돼 있어요

translation.en: and know the price that they pay if they snitch,
it's pretty rare that you get one, maybe two to be cooperative with us.
translation.ko: 그래서 수사에 협조할 사람을 둘이나 찾은 건 드문 일이었죠

translation.en: So that was huge.
[Manuel] By the time he hears the gunshot, he comes outside of the car.
He's coming out.
And at this time, I hear several other gunshot noises.
I was kind of scared because of the fact that…
I know how many people are in this organization.
translation.ko: 이 조직에 몸담은 사람이 얼마나 많은지 알거든요

translation.en: And it's not something that you end.
[woman] You've seen Little Huero on meth?
translation.ko: - 우에로가 약에 취한 걸 봤나요? - 네

translation.en: -[Manuel] Yeah. -[woman] You've never smoked with him?
translation.ko: - 같이 하진 않았고요? - 같이 하지도 않았고

translation.en: [Manuel] Never smoked with him, never seen him do it,
translation.ko: - 같이 하진 않았고요? - 같이 하지도 않았고 하는 걸 보지도 못했지만 약을 한다는 건 알아요

translation.en: but I know he's on it, his eyeballs are all opened up.
translation.ko: 하는 걸 보지도 못했지만 약을 한다는 건 알아요 항상 눈동자가 풀려 있거든요

translation.en: It was just crazy to see them testifying against my brother, you know?
translation.ko: 훌리오에게 불리한 증언을 하는 걸 보니 속상했어요

translation.en: 'Cause they grew up with us, you know?
They were always there. They were always at our house.
translation.ko: 우리 집에 놀러 왔고 살다시피 했거든요

translation.en: [Will] So I saw when Little Huero dumped the first shot.
translation.ko: 리틀 우에로가 첫 발을 쏜 건 봤지만

translation.en: I didn't see the other shots. I saw the first one.
translation.ko: 그다음 건 못 봤어요 첫 발만 봤어요

translation.en: I did feel hurt, you know? Because we would hang out every day,
and I just thought, for you to make up lies just to get out of something.
translation.ko: 자기들만 살겠다고 거짓말을 지어내는 걸 보니까요

translation.en: [interviewer] Did you have interactions with them? Did they talk to you?
Not at all. They were just looking at me, but I didn't want to look at them.
[Amalia] I think it was Manuel's crying, um,
when he was testifying, so…
[Manuel] I know he didn't mean to do all those things he did.
translation.ko: 작정하고 저지른 짓이 아니란 거 알아요

translation.en: Like how everyone in this world doesn't mean to do it.
[Amalia] The comments that the judge made were really harsh.
"Mr. Heredia is not a good person."
"He is a violent, cold-blooded murderer."
"And he is going to pay for what he has done."
[Manuel] We lived in the fast lane.
We did things that you can't even think of.
translation.ko: 보통 사람은 상상도 못 할 일도 저질렀고요

translation.en: For those things, we get nightmares.
[Justin] I live it every day. I can't… drive down the street where I grew up…
translation.ko: 매일 생각해요, 어려서 살던 동네를 지나갈 수가 없어요

translation.en: [voice breaks] without flashing back.
[Robbie] I've had dreams about her, just…
I just hold tight to all my memories.
[Jaimie] It was about a month ago.
Crystal was standing there.
And she was in this white dress.
And then I woke up.
[Manuel] Now it's going to be difficult forgiving myself.
Mom and Dad always try to protect me,
translation.ko: 엄마 아빠는 늘 절 보호하려고 하셨죠

translation.en: always try to have something good for me.
And I'm… I'm trying not to let them down again.
I want to have kids. Raise a family.
You know, do something.
[Belinda] It was personal between William Sotelo and I.
It's not over until he's apprehended.
And I feel like I just need him in custody so Crystal can rest.
translation.ko: 그놈을 잡아야 크리스털이 쉴 수 있을 거 같아요

translation.en: Let's see what William Sotelo…
Oh, and Unity.
It shows me that wherever he is, he's not doing too badly.
translation.ko: 그놈이 어디 있는지 몰라도 잘살고 있네요

translation.en: This is beautiful. The High Priestess.
Now this would represent me.
And it shows that I'm wise enough
translation.ko: 저는 현명해서 인생에서 앞으로 나아가도 좋다고

translation.en: to take the steps to move forward in my life.
translation.ko: 저는 현명해서 인생에서 앞으로 나아가도 좋다고 말하고 있네요

translation.en: And I'm to listen to my intuition and have patience
and consider carefully what I want before I act.
And then the Justice card.
He's ours. They're going to get him one day.
translation.ko: 이놈은 내 거예요 언젠간 잡을 거예요

translation.en: Better times are coming.
Yes.
[Belinda] Justice and revenge.
Yes, they are just about the same thing.
One means you can stay in the free world, and the other means you can go sit in the defendant's chair.
translation.ko: 하지만 한쪽은 자유롭게 살고 다른 쪽은 피고석에 앉게 되죠

translation.en: And that's a line I almost crossed myself.
